name: West Side YMCA

reviews.text: The Rooms are Small, really small but what a wonderful location.
reviews.title: Yes the rooms are small but what a location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is so easy to get around Manhatten from here, columbus Circle is just three small blocks away. Time Square is about 5minute subway ride away.
reviews.title: Great Experiance

reviews.text: We rarely had to wait for a bathroom but I sugest that you ask for a room away from the elevators and bathrooms as I imagine it would be quite noisy.
reviews.title: You don't have to feel down

likes.disliked: — Not as much fun as some hostels I've stayed in

reviews.text: We did this and our rooms were very quiet, the beds are small but quite comfortable. The top bunk is very high and my husband was a little worried about rolling over and falling out, fortunatly he didn't.
reviews.title: Don't Expect a Lot

likes.disliked: — Tiny rooms, problems with shared bathrooms

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: We had a renovated floor, we think this just consisted of new bathrooms as the rooms and hallways seam to only have a coat of paint on them.

Back in college, our band director gave our apartment one of his kid's old single-size mattresses. We affectionately called the bed "the hot dog bed" as the two sides would fold up around you anytime you got into bed.
reviews.title: Even kids with chicken pox

reviews.text: I visited the Y in April 2008, and very much enjoyed a "hot dog bed" experience on the 8th floor.
reviews.title: Way Better than expected!

likes.liked: — The price, location and view from the room
likes.disliked: — The window in my room was nailed shut and could not be opened

reviews.text: Tonight, the Y. Why not? It's NYC.
reviews.title: you can get yourself clean...you can have a good meal

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 days and I couldn't have been happier with this hostel. I had a deluxe room with a semi private bathroom on the renovated 13th floor. The receptionist was very welcoming and helpful upon arrival and check in was very swift.
reviews.title: Right at Central Park

likes.liked: — LOCATION, cheap, functional, basic and simple
likes.disliked: — the look of the corridors, really off-putting

reviews.text: When I arrived to my room I had noticed the carpet was filthy and hadn't been vaccumed since the last guest checked out. I walked down the corridoor to check out the bathrooms and one of the cleaning ladied appologised and said she would be up to the room to vaccum soon.
reviews.title: Its Fun to Stay at the...YMCA!!!

likes.liked: — It was WARM, SAFE place to sleep!!
likes.disliked: — Bunk beds moved during the night...so you lost your duvet to the person below!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I first stayed here 10 years ago in 1998 when travelling with some university friends. When returning to NYC for the first time with my fiance as part of a longer trip, our restricted budget made me decide to stay here again. In many ways I wished I had left this with my other memories of being 19 as returning as a 29 year old wasn't that great an experience.
reviews.title: Great location, but the whole places needs a refit

reviews.text: The first mistake was not booking a room directly with the hostel but booking it online. Online I was shown a picture of a double room, in reality we got bunk beds as there are no double rooms. We also stayed in a cheaper room on one of the unrefurbished floors. I did see a room & a bathroom on one of the other floors, but in the end opted not to spend another $100 upgrading, it just didn't seem worth it.
reviews.title: A NYC Deal

reviews.text: On the plus side, the room gets serviced every day & because this is New York, you really don't spend a lot of time in it anyway. There's also a tv, but you'll struggle to tune it into any channel & you will never find a remote control. The staff were also friendly & you do have free use of hte YMCA swimming pool & gym, but you'll need to wear a swimming hat if you want to go in the pool.
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.disliked: — A bit noisy in the mornings

reviews.text: The main downside is the bathrooms. There simply aren't enough & they get dirty really quickly. The showers are tiny & there's no room to change or to get any privacy. The sink taps only ran boiling hot water which makes cleaning your teeth rather unpleasant. Of the 3 toilets, one of them was blocked & dirty for the whole 5 nights we were there. The air con unit in the room is noisy & you won't want it on all night.
reviews.title: A great place to stay!!

reviews.text: Personally, I think this place is geared to young travellers, this is probably why my 19 year old self thought it was ok. If you're over 21 & would usually stay in a YHA double room with ensuite, this will be a rude awakening. If you're used to more home comforts than the YHA, don't come here!
reviews.title: A Great Place

likes.disliked: — internet access was expensive compared to home 12 dollars an hour , but it seems to be the same all over the cit

reviews.text: Stayed at the West Side YMCA with two girl friends in the Summer of 2006. We were on a tight budget so chose a hostel over a hotel. It was great value, and in a great location too- just across the road from Central Park and a ten minute walk to Times Square.
reviews.title: Great value!

likes.disliked: — Sharing a bathroom (but that's what you get with a hostel I guess!)

reviews.text: Room was clean and very basic- the room I shared with a friend had a bunk bed and TV. All rooms had air-con which was essential as the weather was very hot at the time.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: The bathroom was located down the hall and it wasn't great having to share with everyone on my floor but I soon got used to it. Just remember to bring your flip flops!
reviews.title: Simple no-frills accom in a great location

likes.liked: — Proximity to everything, safe and clean neighbourhood, 1 minute to Central Park

reviews.text: If you're on a budget and don't mind sharing a bathroom with everyone on your floor then I recommended this hostel. Lets face it, there's so much to do and see in NY you'll barely stay inside anyway!
reviews.title: Great location, basic facilities

likes.liked: — Excellent location next to central park and subway
likes.disliked: — Rooms were worn & dingy, water supply was variable!

reviews.text: had the pleasure of staying at the ymca for five days with 30 teenagers.first time in new york.i thought it was a great place to stay.so near to everything i wanted to see.basic accomodation but so clean.bed linen changed every day.all you need is a place to lay your head and a warm shower,rest of the time youre out seeing the sights.you can grab a breakfast downstairs for little cost and its lovely.i would recomend it to anyone who has the luck to visit new york.i fully intend to go again and hopefully will get a room at the ymca.who needs posh hotels? central park just 5 min walk away.and ten or so mins walk from times square,broadway etc. its all there waiting.save money on accomodation then youve more to spend!!!! visit grand central station and go up the empire state building.all situated within walking distance.go on get booking and have a great time.i did.
reviews.title: Excellent location, perfect for a short stay

description: Located just off Central Park West and steps from the Columbus Circle Travel hub, our New York hostel guest rooms offer private Single and Bunk rooms that provide a home away from home for nearly 130,000 International and Domestic budget travelers each year.Our ideal location in NYC allows guests to enjoy the beauty of Central Park, the energy of Times Square and world famous cultural institutions including Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and the Museum of Natural History. As a hotel guest of the West Side YMCA, you can enjoy FREE use of our 65,000 square foot Health and Wellness Facility - including two indoor swimming pools. We're easily accessible to all NYC public transportation - uptown, downtown, cross-town buses, and the 1,A,C,E,B,D,N subway lines.Guest Rooms Facilities IncludeCable TVShared Bathrooms on each floor (some private facilities)Air-conditioningHousekeeping - Clean Linens and Towels providedElevator BuildingAround the clock check-in24 hour securityFree WiFi in lobby areaSafe Deposit boxesNo Curfew
